definitions.definition: To get used to a new climate , or to a new situation.
To make used to a new climate or one that is different from that which is natural ; to inure or habituate to other circumstances ; to adapt to the peculiarities of a foreign or strange climate .
examples: acclimatize the staff to the new regulations

main_definition: ( intransitive ) To get used to a new climate , or to a new situation.
secondary_definitions: ( transitive ) To make used to a new climate or one that is different from that which is natural ; to inure or habituate to other circumstances ; to adapt to the peculiarities of a foreign or strange climate .
